alert.note: Alert for Barry; Lawrence; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 1:26AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL NEWTON...NORTHERN BARRY AND SOUTHERN LAWRENCE COUNTIES THROUGH 215 AM CDT... At 126 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pierce City, or 7 miles northwest of Monett, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Monett, Aurora, Mount Vernon, Marionville, Pierce City, Purdy, Verona, Stotts City, Freistatt, Wentworth, Hoberg, Wheelerville, Jenkins, Mcdowell, Pleasant Ridge and Madry. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 33 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
